archimate:ArchimateDiagramModel.name: ServiceNow detailed design
archimate:ArchimateDiagramModel.documentation:
ServiceNow has three different interfaces
1) ServiceNow User Interface, which is used by any ServiceNow user (Tietoevry or Customer) to gain access to ServiceNow portal. Access is possible through any web browser. Users are authenticated using central multiprovider SSO which is realized by Tietoevry IdP system. This is the standard user interface used for using ServiceNow
2) ServiceNow Admin Interface, is used by Tietoevry SeviceNow administrators to maintain the system software. Account permissions are handled within ServiceNow and varies from read-only to powerfull accounts allowing creating new users, access all data etc. Initial authentication is password based but upon 1st login, system enforces enablement of multifactor authentication. TOTP solution is used and administrators are instructed to use Google Authenticator as key generator. OTP-key is stroed within the ServiceNow Database
3) API interface, is used by various application integrations to exchange data with ServiceNow system. API clients are authenticating with static passwords and the credential access policy varies.
How service is exposed to end user?
All of the user interfaces are exposed to public internet through a network load balancer. Communication is encrypted all the way from client to the ServiceNow application server running on backend network.
ServiceNow data is stored within Database server on the same backend network with the application servers.
Load balancers, or other devices in the data path are not inspecting the application payload due it is encrypted. Therefore the network devices are only filtering traffic based on IP address and ports and are limited on filtering only common IP based attacks (like SYN flood etc.) Otherwise the traffic is forwarded unfiltered to the application server on the backend.
What data is on the system?
ServiceNow has a big database where data is stored in multiple tables. In our context the most relevant are:
- ServiceNow Account data, which is storing users of the system among their permissions. Admin users do also hve the OTP-key stored among their account - ServiceNow Audit log data, which is information on access or changes done to the system - ServiceNow Customer data, which is any customer data which needs protection
How accounts are handled?
- End user accounts, are provisioned through Tietoevry IdP system - Admin accounts, are created manually by Operations teams using specifig process - Virtual accounts, are created manually by Operations teams using specifig process
